intro: Philibertella heterophylla, commonly known as the variable-leaved philibertella, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it grows in rocky and sandy soils. The plant is characterized by its variable leaf shapes, which range from ovate to lanceolate, and its showy, pinkish-white flowers. It typically blooms during the summer months and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions. Due to its unique morphology and habitat preferences, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
